titles.title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to reiterate the denial of the charitable contribution deduction for transfers associated with split-dollar insurance arrangements.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

bill.summary: 2/9/1999--Introduced. States that nothing in specified Internal Revenue Code provisions concerning the disallowance of the charitable deduction contribution shall be construed to permit a deduction for a transfer to or for the use of a charitable organization if the organization pays or has paid, or there is an understanding that any person will pay, personal benefit contract premiums on the transferor's behalf. Subjects such non-deductible payments to an excise tax.
